Class Candidate

java.lang.Object
Candidate
public class Candidate extends Object
The Candidate class represents a candidate in an election, storing information such as name, ballot count, associated party, and a list of received ballots.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    Candidate(String name)
    Constructs a Candidate object with the specified name.

      Removes the candidate from the election.

    • isInElection

      public boolean isInElection()
      Checks if the candidate is still in the election.
      Returns:
      True if the candidate is in the election, false otherwise.

    • removeBallot

      public Ballot removeBallot()
      Removes and returns the first received ballot. If no ballots are present, returns null.
      Returns:
      The first received ballot or null if no ballots are present.

    • addToBallotList

      public void addToBallotList(Ballot b)
      Adds a new ballot to the list of received ballots and increments the ballot count.
      Parameters:
      b - The ballot to be added.

    • getBallots

      public ArrayList<Ballot> getBallots()
      Gets the list of received ballots by the candidate (for testing purposes).
      Returns:
      The list of received ballots.
